name: SUGAR
lyrics:
[Chorus: Ryan Beatty]
Spendin' all my nights alone, waitin' for you to call me
You're the only one I want by my side when I fall asleep
Tell me what I'm waitin' for, tell me what I'm waitin' for
I know it's hard but we need each other
Know it's hard but we need each other

[Verse 1: Dom McLennon]
I move mountains on my own, don't need nobody help
Changed your mind when I changed my life, better start believin' in myself
And we all out lookin' for, lookin' for God so we never see it in ourself
Shit, divine intervention move in stealth
It's hard to tell what the prayer compelled
You can find me dancin' in between the raindrops
Tryna find a way to make the pain stop
Overtime, on the graveyard
Got a nigga feeling brainwashed
My instability's trademark
Copy-written in all my decisions
This is not supposed to be a way of livin'
Turned my temple down into a prison, shit

[Chorus: Ryan Beatty]
Spendin' all my nights alone, waitin' for you to call me
You're the only one I want by my side when I fall asleep
Tell me what I'm waitin' for, tell me what I'm waitin' for
I know it's hard but we need each other
Know it's hard but we need each other

[Verse 2: Matt Champion]
Yeah, back on Vincent with the braces on
Used to slide out the back without the neighbors knowin'
Pose for the picture with the pearly whites
Dead lens zoomin' in, catchin' all my strikes
Used to trade Jordan for some molly
And she gave me all I need for the night, forties suffice
Morally alright, but I need some advice
And I know that I'm actin' foolish
Chris would pick me up around noon-ish
Half a blunt, yeah, we coolin'
Twist it up, puttin' on OutKast
Hunnid, Texas heat, and yeah, we cruisin'

[Pre-Chorus: bearface]
But when I love you right, I love you right
All by yourself
But I'll make it bright, baby, I want you to know
I'ma be there for you, I'ma make you see that
I want you, I want you

[Chorus: Ryan Beatty]
Spendin' all my nights alone, waitin' for you to call me
You're the only one I want by my side when I fall asleep
Tell me what I'm waitin' for, tell me what I'm waitin' for
I know it's hard but we need each other
Know it's hard but we need each other

[Bridge: Kevin Abstract]
Back and forth
I'll take that if that's all you askin' for
With my legs up on the dashboard
Only thing in my pocket is my passport, pa-passport
Back and forth
I'll take that if that's all you askin' for
With my legs up on the dashboard
Only thing in my pocket is my passport, pa-passport
Back and forth
I'll take that if that's all you askin' for
With my legs up on the dashboard
Only thing in my pocket is my passport, pa-passport

[Outro: bearface]
So, do you love me, love me, love me?
Do you love me, love me, love me?
Do you love me, love me, love me?
Do you love me, love me? Oh
Do you love me, love me, love me?
Do you love me, love me, love me?
Do you love me, love me, love me?
Do you love me, love me? Oh
annotations:
[('Changed your mind when I changed my life,', [['This could mean either one of two things


Is that Dom was broken up with and he decided to change him self for the better after the relationship, and that made his Ex want to date him again



or


While in a relationship Dom changed something big within his life (maybe becoming famous or changing his main focus to making music) and that made his partner want to break up with him



either way both scenarios are pretty similar']]), ('[Bridge: Kevin Abstract]', [['In a MTV interview,  Kevin talks about how his bridge and what he thinks about with Sugar is it’s a song about being in a relationship and not really knowing where it’s going, but being okay with that.

What’s interesting is that fan’s also have conveyed this feeling when listening to Sugar. On this podcast fans convey that the bridge of Sugar reminds them of the same feeling of not knowing what they are doing and being okay with that.']]), ('[Verse 2: Matt Champion]', [['In an interview with MTV, Matt Champion talks about how the hook Ryan Beatty put down on this song reminds him of highschool.

Matt grew up in Woodlands, Texas, a suburb outside of Houston. Matt, Kevin Abstract, Ameer Vann (now removed from the band), Merlyn Wood, and JOBA all met at Woodlands High School, but the band was formed through a Kanye fan page with all the other members.

This verse describes Matt’s high school experience in a nostalgic way.']]), ('Overtime, on the graveyard', [['The graveyard refers to “The Graveyard Shift” a phrase coined in the 1800’s but was brought back into modern popular culture from Stephen King’s short story of the same name.

The graveyard shift is typically considered between Midnight and 8 AM. Dom is stating in a play on words that his overworking deep into the late nights is gonna lead him to the graveyard or his death, as well as has feeling delusional, or brainwashed, as stated in the line following this.

This could be talking about his standard jobs before Brockhampton took off, or his and the group need to overwork themselves to the point of being considered as clocking in overtime, and as shown in the Saturation Documentary, the group would sometimes spend their time up until the early mornings giving the finishing touches on their albums the day before their release.']]), ('Only thing in my pocket is my passport, pa-passport', [['This isn’t the first time Kevin has referenced his passport, as he mentioned the item on their 2017 song “BLEACH”:

I forgot my passport, for sure, all for a pretty sky

However, he uses it in a different context this time. Whereas then Kevin’s passport was symbolic of him pursuing feelings over tangible objects, now it helps build a romantic scene. Kevin is going on a road trip with his partner, and all he needs is his passport to allow him access to wherever they find themselves.

He also referenced the document in his 2016 song “Empty,” in which he raps:

I hate my yearbook photo
I hate my passport, I hate my last name
I hate everything it stands for

In this context, his passport contained information that could be used to arbitrarily define him. It was a symbol he used to express his distaste for a one-dimensional view of a person. Now, it seems he has come to terms with it and is okay with carrying it around.

While having his passport now may be seen as a sign of maturity and growth, Kevin is still living care-free, not tied down by money or social media, as represented by objects typically found in pockets: wallets and phones.']]), ('Twist it up, puttin’ on OutKast', [['OutKast is a duo from Atlanta, made up of rap legends André 3000 and Big Boi. The group put out some of the most critically acclaimed hip-hop records of all time, such as September 2003’s Speakerboxxx / The Love Below and August 1996’s ATLiens, and was wildly successful until their hiatus in 2006.

In a June 2019 interview with GQ, BROCKHAMPTON co-founder Kevin Abstract said that the material from GINGER sounded like the iconic OutKast hit “Hey Ya!” The group’s 2018 track, “1999 WILDFIRE,” also drew many comparisons to another OutKast song, “The Love Below.”

Additionally, In an August 2019 interview with Sway’s Universe, Matt Champion said that OutKast was one of the first groups that he came across when he began listening to the genre.']])]

[('What you know about love?', [['This is like the character of the song starting to realise that the girl he is dancing with is superficial and not here for the long term. She doesn’t care about him so how could she know about feelings such as love?']]), ('Yeah right, yeah right
 Yeah, you know I feel right

 Bitch, you ain’t even my type', [['What do you know about family and what do you know about true values of friendship? Because if you’re here with me, surely you can’t have great values. And by me, I mean, not me but the character of the song.

“Bitch, you ain’t even my type”, is a moment of realization. It’s like, I know that it’s like you’re not even my type, but like I said, I don’t mind.']]), ('What you know about life?', [['I mean, the way I see life is like, no-one’s special. You’re not born special, if you’re lucky you’re given a certain set of skills and a certain set of resources and you run with them, and then everyone dies. So as long as they know that, and they’re not thinking in a God’s plan sort of way, ‘cause it’s like, “Why is God only looking out for one person?” That’s stupid, it’s not in your favor all the time. So just stuff like that, that’s what I would assume, like do you know what’s happening right now? Do you understand that it’s flesh? I don’t know.']]), ('Yeah, you bet I go to see you when
 I’m feeling like a drum without a beat
 Yeah, you dance so good
 And I think that’s kinda neat', [['You don’t mind this whole thing going on, you gotta keep in mind of that. So when you’re just lonely, if she’s available, as with like a filthy old man, you’ll still go to see her when you’re feeling like a drum without a beat. Even though you know that you’re giving out, and doing all this and that.']]), ('Yeah, you bet she know that we ain’t
 Never gonna be together, I see', [['It’s very obvious that she does not see a future, or she doesn’t want to be with me in any sort of way, in any other given circumstance.']]), ('Yeah, you bet I know that she ain’t
 Never give a single fuck about me', [['You definitely know when someone doesn’t give a fuck about you when they’re not checking you at all. I feel like if they’re very indifferent, but they’re just like, to everything you say … you’re like, “Is this a good thing, is this a bad thing?” They’re like, “Yeah, yeah. Whatever.” Oftentimes, people that don’t care, there’s different types but in this sense, if we’re talking about these lyrics, I would think the girl is literally just using this guy. I know I said there are no pronouns, but there totally are, I’m sorry.

I would say they don’t give a fuck when they become indifferent. Because if they’re mad, and they’re still interacting with you, then they still care, obviously. But if they’re not interacting at all, and they’re just kind of going along with everything you do, then if you’re not rich, then they’re just indifferent. If you do have something to offer to them, they would just stick around but still be indifferent.']]), ('Yeah, right, yeah, right
 Yeah, I bet you won’t cry
 Yeah, I bet you won’t try
 But you know I don’t mind
 But you know I don’t mind', [['This person doesn’t mind because the self-hatred has already been established. This is a person that’s way past self-hatred, someone who’s already very honest with themselves, and they’re like … look, it could be just a person and their significant other in a room together, or just the thought of them being in a relationship or something, and it’s like, “Listen, I know I’m not getting any younger. This is this and that.” You hit an age, you’re like, yeah, well I mean this is like, I got this, this is great for now, if it doesn’t turn out to be great it’s whatever, but this is what I have now and I don’t think I’m gonna find anything much better so I’m gonna stick to this and I don’t mind. Because it’s not destructive, it’s not productive, but it’s not destructive.

That’s how a lot of people get stuck, I feel like, in relationships and also just life in general. They’re just getting comfortable, and this person who’s singing this song doesn’t mind the lifestyle of just, you know … being with girls with the bottles and stuff, that’s cool too. I’m like that, every now and then maybe.']]), ('We gon’ party all night
 She don’t care if I die', [["For “She don’t care if I die”, it’s like, “I'ma fuck up my life, and we’re gonna party all night.” So I’ve introduced that, we’re partying and we’re having a good time, but this chick, once again adding to the fucking song topic, she doesn’t care if I die. I could fall over in the club right now and have a heart attack, and you’d probably run or something. Or not, who am I to judge? But I wouldn’t trust you as a hospital contact or anything. I think I'ma stick to … yeah. Yeah, someone else. But you know, that’s still like, she doesn’t care if I die, I’m dancing with this chick or I’m with this chick, and she doesn’t care if I die."]]), ('I’ma fuck up my life
 I’ma fuck up my life
 I’ma fuck up my life
 I’ma fuck up my life', [["The way I see it, is this person is dancing or at a location or something, and it’s all momentary. It’s like, time stops, and he’s like, “I'ma fuck up my life.” Or it’s the act of being in a function or being with a girl and you’re just thinking like, “If I stay with this, if I keep doing this, I'ma fuck up my life.” It’s that kind of brutal self-honesty that I thought it’d be nice to open up the song with. It’s like, this is not great, but I’m still doing it because what other option do I have? Which I see a lot of men get into situations like that."]])]

name: The Loser
lyrics:
[Verse]
Started out with peanuts, young street dreamer
Feeling like Ace Boogie when he first quit the cleaners
Almost shocked the world, Muhammad Ali
I’m back stabbing, Calvin ass niggas tryna team up
Back watching my nigga because I’m watching for niggas
Who wanna stop me my nigga but trust me I’mma get richer
By any means, like macking with that thing in that picture
I ain't ringing like a iPhone, niggas wanna leave me cause
When you get money, trouble tend to come your way
If you play, raise my gun like my son in your face
I bust it like a nut, made me cum on your face
I go off like a bomb, think Saddam in this place
A lot of niggas in the way, still in a turtle race
But you know it ain’t no fun when the rabbit got the cake
I go hard like a pallet in yo place
And I ain’t spraying like Proactive in your face, you niggas at me to the streets
I can’t believe niggas believe niggas
Bet, you could check my background
Yea, I was gone for a minute but I’m back now
And you little niggas, summer’s over, fallback now
I done fell down a couple times, crawl back now
Hoes ain’t used to answer for me, now they call back now
I ain’t used to be shit, they think I’m all that now
Niggas hollering beef shit back to me, y'all on cow  worse
Yea, and these is words of a real nigga
No matter where, hand you a Dolce got a deal with it
And how I feel is how I feel, there’s no feel niggas
Cause fake niggas paralyze real niggas
Back when I was little loved to idolize real niggas
And see how much it says really do kill niggas
They ain’t gon' feel you til they kill you
I’m top five dead or alive,  one of the realest
Just the ordinary life of a G
I can’t believe these niggas want stripes off of me
Niggas I grew up with, I can’t even fuck with
He can’t look you in the eyes, then a nigga suspect
That’s the reason I can’t trust shit
But my vision colorful as TrukFit
I could see the future
I could see the winners and the loser
Copping Versace, I feel like Medusa
Snakes around my head, snakes around my bed
Snakes all in the yard, damn, gotta cut the grass
Niggas I give my last, they don’t even wanna see me last
Take the good with the bad but damn this shit bad
Get money, don’t get mad
I said get money, don’t get married
Only wife of mine just this life of crime
When I started fronting with Duck I almost got fired
I remember hearing shots fired in the hospital dog
Said he thrown apart, can’t recognize
I’m up nine, mane backin' down
It’s trap life til my casket down
This my city, you can ask around
And if I’m lying in that case, a fish can drown
My god, we ain’t no motherfuckin biscuit town
Yall can keep all that bullshit, just don’t forget the crown
King shit
annotations:
[('Niggas I give my last, they don’t even wanna see me last', [['People that Doe B would give his last to, doesn’t even want to see him last. Or even doing good.']]), ('I’m top five dead or alive,  one of the realest', [['He’s saying dead or alive, he should be in your top 5 best rappers list. Because he is a good rapper & is one of the realest to handle a mic.']]), ('Niggas hollering beef shit back to me, y’all on cow  worse', [['The line is supposed to be “Niggas hollering beef shit but to me all of em cow-ards”. Meaning that dudes are always talking about beefing but when it comes down to it Doe B thinks they’re bitches.']]), ('I ain’t used to be shit, they think I’m all that now', [['Back when Doe B was broke with no money, females used to say he wasn’t shit & played him. Now that he is rich & famous they think he’s all that.']]), ('Hoes ain’t used to answer for me, now they call back now', [['Females used to screen his phone calls but now since he is famous & rich, they won’t only answer but they call back when he calls.']]), ('By any means, like macking with that thing in that picture', [['The line is supposed to be “By any means, like Malcolm with that thing in that picture”. “By any means” is a popular catchphrase that Malcolm X used to let everyone know that he believed in self-defense. Meaning he would protect hisself by any means, no matter if that means harming another human being.. so be it. Doe B is referring to a infamous picture of Malcolm X holding a AK-47 looking out a window. By the line “By any means, like Malcolm with that thing in that picture”, Doe B is saying he agrees with Malcolm X’s logic and will shoot and kill someone about his personal safety.']]), ('Almost shocked the world, Muhammad Ali', [['Muhammad Ali was one of the greatest heavyweight boxers in the world, often shocking the world with his speed and strength. Doe’s bars are often good enough to shock the world in the same way Ali did.']]), ('Snakes all in the yard, damn, gotta cut the grass', [['Doe B continues the snake references. He’s saying that he’s surrounded by snakes, which is another word used to mean snitches and backstabbers.

“Snake in the grass” is an expression that refers to a sneaky, conniving person.

The snakes Doe B is surrounded with keep themselves hidden so well that Doe B needs to metaphorically “cut the grass” to see who’s fake and who’s real.']]), ('A lot of niggas in the way, still in a turtle race
 But you know it ain’t no fun when the rabbit got the cake', [['A lot of niggas in the way, still in a turtle race

In this line, Doe B uses “turtle race” to mean the same thing as “rat race”, an intensely competitive struggle for success. Doe B is in the struggle with a lot of competitors in his way.

But you know it ain’t no fun when the rabbit got the cake

This line refers to the Aesop’s fable called The Tortoise and the Hare, in which an overly confident hare (similar to a rabbit) challenges a slow tortoise (similar to a turtle) to a race. The race starts and the hare speeds past the tortoise and eventually decides he’s far enough along to warrant taking a nap, leading to the turtle slowly but surely beating the hare.

Doe B says that he isn’t happy when the metaphorical rabbit (who is usually seen as the villain of the Fable) achieves success–or takes the “cake”–instead of him.']]), ('But my vision colorful as TrukFit', [['Doe B’s compares his vivid vision for the future to TrukFit, which is Lil Wayne’s clothing brand, because of its colorful products.']])]

name: Pluto Projector
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
The great protector
Is that what I'm supposed to be?
What if all this counts for nothing
Everything I thought I'd be?
What if by the time I realize
It's too far behind to see?
Seventy-mil projector
I can show you everything, yeah
And we're on our way to glory
Where the show won't ever end
And the encore lasts forever
And it's time we're due to spend

[Verse 2]
Spending the years together
Growing older every day (Every day)
I feel at home when I'm around you
And I'll gladly say again
I hope the encore lasts forever
Now there's time for us to spend
And it's sublime with you, my friend
This right here still feels like a honeymoon
When you say my name, nothing's changed
I'm still a boy inside my thoughts
Am I meant to understand my faults?

[Chorus]
I don't think so
I don't think I'm meant to understand myself
Maybe you do
And that's good for you
Maybe in time
Maybe one day
I'll do the same
(I'll do the same
I'll do the same
I'll do the same)

[Bridge]
I'll do the same as you
I'll try and hold it up
Soon I hope
Or as soon as I'm old enough
(Old enough to understand
Old enough to understand)

[Outro]
Stay forever, you know more than anyone (Yeah, whoa)
And it's you that knows my darkness
And you know my bedroom needs
You could blast me and my secrets
But there's probably just no need
annotations:
[('I’m still a boy inside my thoughts
 Am I meant to understand my faults?', [['In this line, Alex is coming to terms with being a young adult and the impact that can have on the relationships in his life. Alex’s career pushed him into stardom during his transition into adulthood, which maybe meant that he didn’t have much alone time to reflect on the changes in his own life.

He understands that he is supposed to be responsible for his actions but his thoughts and biases from his childhood sometimes make it difficult for him to accept that. He asks the question, ‘Am I meant to understand my faults?’ in the hopes that maybe he isn’t the only one with these immature tendencies but acknowledges that it’s something that he needs to work on as he grows as a person, as he doesn’t want it to affect his relationship with his girlfriend, Thea.']]), ('Spending the years together
 Growing older every day (Every day)
 I feel at home when I’m around you
 And I’ll gladly say again
 I hope the encore lasts forever', [['Alexander and his girlfriend Thea have been together for almost 4 years now, their anniversary is on October 31st. He’s saying that he feels safe around her, and he’s hoping that they’ll last forever']]), ('Seventy-mil projector
 I can show you everything,', [['Rex refers here to a 70-millimeter film projector. 70mm is a high-resolution film format that uses frames that are larger and wider in aspect ratio than the standard 35mm. From an audience’s standpoint, the images on-screen are much more crisp, uniform, and bright. Over the past few years, many big-ticket movies such as Interstellar (2014), Dunkirk (2017), and Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019) have used the format.

In context, Rex is saying that he has much more to offer to this person – who is likely his longtime girlfriend, Thea – than anyone else.']])]

name: I Think There's Something You Should Know
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
I think there's something you should know
I don't feel like myself, I'm not gonna lie (Lie)
How would you know? It doesn't show
I think there's something you should know (Know, know)
I think there's something you should know
I’m feeling like someone, like somebody else
I don’t feel myself, it could be my health
I'd like to meet myself and swap clothes
I think there's something you should know

[Refrain]
(I think there's something)
(I don't wanna be someone else)
(I don't wanna be someone else)
(I don't wanna be someone—)
(I don't wanna be someone else)

[Bridge]
You get a moment when you feel alright
You get a moment when you feel alright
You get a moment when you feel alright
You get a moment when you feel alright

[Verse 2]
I feel so seen and I can't dream
Sleeping terrifies me, otherwise, I'm fine
See-saw back and forth, back on the door, back on the floor
Oh, please ignore me, I'm just feeling sorry for myself
Feeling like someone, like somebody else, who don’t feel themself
Paying for their wealth with their mental health
I'd like to meet myself and swap clothes
I think there's someplace I should go
I think there's something you should know

[Outro]
I think there's something you should know
I think there's something you should know
annotations:
[('I’d like to meet myself and swap clothes', [['Since 2002 when the band formed, Healy has experimented with a range of styles with not only his music, but himself – his appearance and overall aesthetic. He is an avid believer of the concept that the clothes one wears truly define them, or more relevantly, the clothes the members of his band wear give an insight into what they’re really about.

In an interview on the official The 1975 YouTube channel, he analyses the aesthetic of himself and his bandmates in the music video for Give Yourself A Try and says:

The tailored trousers, the height of the trousers, the shortness of the blazer – the reference to kind of post-punk ideas. We look like a fucking band, you know? And that’s what I want my band to look like and this was the first time that I was like yeah we’re a band; we’re an identifiable thing.

It is noticeable that Healy often drastically changes his hairstyle or his style of clothes during or after the production of an album (evidenced below) – this reflects his overall state of mind. He has said on multiple occasions that writing songs and making albums really affects him in a way that almost demands change. With every new creation of music, and so with every new outfit or style, he becomes wiser and more knowledgeable. This is the reason for him wanting to swap clothes – he craves realistic omniscience, to an instrumental extent.']]), ('Paying for their wealth with their mental health', [['Matty is expressing the fact that he feels bereft of himself. Someone who is lacking the ability to see the wood from the trees, but can use this make great art.

A struggle for many artists who become successful, is handling the aspect of being able to succeed by handling certain situations i.e. their mental health.

Often music is a vehicle to dealing with personal issues, and it’s not a bad thing to do so. But questions will arise if the songs are particularly personal, and then commercially successful.

Matty will be struggling with the fact that he is someone who wants to keep their success going, but feels guilty about his mental state. Should he maintain a clear mental state and risk losing his art? Or does he continue pursuing his art and risk his mental health deteriorating?']]), ('You get a moment when you feel alright
 You get a moment when you feel alright
 You get a moment when you feel alright
 You get a moment when you feel alright', [['Matty is simply stating that in the midst of all that goes on, there is momentary bliss where he feels ok with everything.

But it’s just one moment, and that’s all we get to feel alright.

In a lot of interviews, Matty references specific moments, not only as an adjective, but in reference to certain times where he’s felt a sense of joy and drive.

https://www.vogue.com/article/matty-healy-1975-new-album-2020

In this interview in particular, he states that writing People on the tour bus was a “moment”. And he is constantly referencing these times in order to denote a sense of direction in the 1975, which is where his purpose comes from.']]), ('I’d like to meet myself and swap clothes', [['From all that we know about Matty Healy, this lyric speaks volumes of his self referencing comments, and his brilliant ability to critique his own character. In an interview with Vogue, Matty notes that:

Every time I make a record I put everything into it, so by the time I record the next one, of course I’m a slightly different person.

Matty has dressed so differently across the last ten years, and this may have had an effect on his whole demeanour at certain stages of his life.



It’s worth saying because if he could swap clothes with himself, he might a different person. And considering he’s meeting himself, he’s acknowledging the difficulties that come with being a multi-faceted human.']]), ('I’m feeling like someone, like somebody else', [['Matty references their song “Somebody Else” from their 2016 release I like it when you sleep, for you are so beautiful yet so unaware of it.

I don’t want your body
But I hate to think about you with somebody else

Meanwhile, Matty is also talking about the inner turmoil that he is facing on a daily basis of not feeling like himself.']])]

annotations:

 Just let me know when I can call you', [['This can mean anything. Like I’m on the verge of a breakdown. Or I’m on the verge of doing something bad. I’m on my last. I need you. So can I call you?']]), ('You don’t want me, but I need you
 I guess I fell for you just to get rid of the pain
 Can’t help but do it all over again', [['You latch on to somebody because you don’t want to feel lonely. You’re not well yourself so you hope that someone else can fix you. You fall in lovely easily because you’re just jumping from one person to another.']]), ('Like a drug addict, I can’t predict how you make me feel
 And I don’t answer my phone unless I see your name', [['This is about the ups and downs. It’s never really a stable relationship- you have these ups and downs. And you don’t know how you’re going to feel the next day. Like you could hate that person or you could fucking love them and be like I’ll answer your call- but in your mind you still hate them.']]), ('I remember when we stayed awake
 The neighbors complained at 4 AM', [['These are just scenarios that happen in real life. It’s remembering the fun times. In the beginning, when you’re up late at night talking. Late night conversations. Keeping the neighbors awake.']]), ('[Chorus]', [['We both know that we’re not good for each other but I am that desperate to still feel or to still try at it. Just because it’s something you’re familiar with so you are scared to let go. It’s like drugs. If you’re familiar with it, you’re going to try to make it work.']])]

name: Lie
lyrics:
**PAEN**

CHORAGOS:[Strophe 1]
God of many names

CHORUS:
O Iacchos
Son
Of Kadmeian Semele
O born of the Thunder!
Guardian of the West
Regent
Of Eleusis’ plain
O Prince of maenad Thebes
And the Dragon Field by rippling Ismenos

CHORAGOS:[Antistrophe 1]
God of many names

CHORUS:
The flame of torches
Flares on our hills
The nymphs of Iacchos
Dance at the spring of Castalia
From the vine-close mountain
Come ah come in ivy:
Evohe evohe! Sings through the streets of Thebes

CHORAGOS:[Strophe 2]
God of many names

CHORUS:
Iacchos of Thebes
Heavenly Child
Of Semele bride of the Thunderer!
The shadow of plague is upon us:
Come
With clement feet
Oh come from Parnasos
Down the long slopes
Across the lamenting water

CHORAGOS:[Antistrophe 2]
Io Fire! Chorister of the throbbing stars!
O purest among the voices of the night!
Thou son of God, blaze for us!

CHORUS:
Come with choric rapture of circling Maenads
Who cry Io Iacche!
God of many names!

**EXODOS**

[*Enter MESSENGER, L.*]

MESSENGER:
Men of the line of Kadmos you who live
Near Amphion’s citadel:
I cannot say
Of any condition of human life “This is fixed,
This is clearly good, or bad.” Fate raises up,
And Fate casts down the happy and unhappy alike:
No man can foretell his Fate.
Take the case of Creon:
Creon was happy once, as I count happiness:
Victorious in battle, sole governor of the land,
Fortunate father of children nobly born.
And now it has all gone from him! Who can say
That a man is still alive when his life’s joy fails?
He is a walking dead man. Grant him rich,
Let him live like a king in his great house:
If his pleasure is gone, is would not give
So much as the shadow of smoke for all he owns.

CHORAGOS:
Your words hint at sorrow: what is your news for us?

MESSENGER:
They are dead. The living are guilt of their death.

CHORAGOS:
Who is guilty? Who is dead? Speak!

MESSENGER:
Haimon.
Haimon is dead; and the hand that killed him
Is his own hand.

CHORAGOS:
His father’s? or his own?

MESSENGER:
His own, driven mad by the murder his father had done.

CHORAGOS:
Teiresias, Teiresias, how clearly you saw it all!

MESSENGER:
This is my news: you must draw what conclusions you can from it.

CHORAGOS:
But look: Eurydice, our Queen:
Has she overheard us?
[Enter UERYDICE from the Palace, C.]

EURIDICE:
I have heard something, friends:
As I was unlocking the gate of Pallas’ shrine,
For I needed her help today, I heard a voice
Telling of some new sorrow. And I fainted
There at the temple with all my maidens about me.
But speak again: whatever it is, I can bear it:
Grief and I are no strangers.

MESSENGER:
Dearest Lady,
I will tell you plainly all that I have seen.
I shall not try to comfort you: what is the use,
Since comfort could lie only in what is not true?
The truth is always best.
I went with Creon
To the outer plain where Polyneices was lying,
No friend to pity him, his body shredded by dogs.
We made our prayers in that place to Hecate
And Pluto, that they would be merciful. And we bathed
The corpse with holy water, and we brought
Fresh-broken branches to burn what was left of it,
And upon the urn we heaped up a towering barrow
Of the earth of his own land.
When we are done, we ran
To the vault where Antigone lay on her couch of stone.
One of the servants had gone ahead,
And while he was yet far off he heard a voice
Grieving within the chamber, and he came back
And told Creon. And as the King went closer,
The air was full of wailing, the words lost,
And he begged us to make all haste. “Am I a prophet?”
He said, weeping, “And must I walk this road,
The saddest of all that I have gone before?
My son’s voice calls me on. Oh quickly, quickly!
Look through the crevice there, and tell me
If it is Haimon, or some deception of the gods!”
We obeyed; and in the cavern’s farthest corner
We saw her lying:
Haimon lay beside hers,
His arms about her waist, lamenting her,
His love lost under ground, crying out
That his father has stolen her away from him.
When Creon saw him the tears rushed to his eyes
And he called to him: “What have you done, child? Speak to me.
What are you thinking that makes your eyes so stranger?
O my son, my son, I come to you on my knees!”
But Haimon spat in his face. He said not a word,
Staring––
And suddenly drew his sword
And lunged. Creon shrank back, the blade missed; and the boy,
Desperate against himself , drove it half its length
Into his own side, and fell. And as he died
He gathered Antigone close in his arms again.
Choking, his blood bright red on her white cheek.
And now he lies dead with the dead, and she is his
At last, his bride in the houses of the dead.
[*Exit EURDICE into the Palace.*]

CHORAGOS:
She has left us without a word. What can this mean?

MESSENGER:
It troubles me, too; yet she knows what is best,
Her grief is too great for public lamentation,
And doubtless she has gone to her chamber to weep
For dead son, leading her maidens in his dirge.

CHORAGOS:
It may be so: but I fear this deep silence.

MESSENGER: [*Pause.*]
I will see what she is doing. I will go in.
[*Exit MESSENGER into the Palace.*]
[*Enter CREON with attendants,
Bearing HAIMON’S body.*]

CHORAGOS:
But here is the King himself: oh look at him,
Bearing his own damnation in his arms.

CREON:
Nothing you say can touch me any more. My own blind heart has brought me
From darkness to final darkness. Here you see
The father murdering, the murdered son––
And all my civic wisdom!
Haimon my son, so young, so young to die,
I was the fool, not you; and you died for me.

CHORAGOS:
That is the truth; but you were late in learning it.

CREON:
This truth is hard to bear. Surely a god
Has crushed me beneath the hugest weight of heaven,
And driven me headlong a barbaric way
To trample out the thing I held most dear.
The pains that men will take to come to pain!
[*Enter MESSENGER from the Palace.*]

MESSENGER:
The burden you carry in your hands is heavy,
But it is not all: you will find more in your house.

CREON:
What burden worse than this shall I find there?

MESSENGER:
The Queen is dead.

CREON:
O port of death, deaf world,
Is there no pity for me? And you, Angel of evil,
I was dead, and your words are death again.
Is it true, boy? Can it be true?
Is my wife dead? Has death bred death?

MESSENGER:
You can see for yourself.
[*The doors are opened, and the body
Of EURDICE is disclosed within.*]

CREON:
Oh pity!
All true, all true, and more than I can bear!
O my wife, my son!

MESSENGER:
She stood before the altar, and her heart
Welcome the knife her own hand guided.
And a great cry burst from her lips for Megareus dead,
And for Haimon dead, her sons; and her last breath
Was a curse for their father, the murdered of her sons.
And she fell, and the dark flowed in through her closing eyes.

CREON:
O God, I am sick with fear.
Are there no swords here? Has no one a blow for me?

MESSENGER:
Her curse is upon you for the deaths of both.

CREON:
It is right that it should be. I alone am guilty.
I know it, and I say it. Lead me in,
Quickly, friends.
I have neither life nor substance. Lead me in.

CHORAGOS:
You are right, if there can be right in so much wrong.
The briefest way is best in a world of sorrow.

CREON:
Let it come,
Let death come quickly, and be kind to me.
I would not ever see the sun again.

CHORAGOS:
All that will come when it will; but we, meanwhile, 1030
Have much to do. Leave the future to itself.

CREON:
All my heart was in that prayer!

CHORAGOS:
Then do not pray any more: the sky is deal

CREON:
Lead me away. I have been rash and foolish.
I have killed my son and my wife.
I look for comfort; my comfort lies here dead.
Whatever my hands have touched has come to nothing.
Fate has brought all my pride to a thought of dust.
[*As CREON is being led into the house, the CHORAGOS advances and speaks
Directly to the audience.*]

CHORAGOS:
There is no happiness where there is no wisdom;
No wisdom but in submission to the gods.
Big words are always punished,
And proud men in old age learn to be wise.
annotations:
[('Fate raises up,
 And Fate casts down the happy and unhappy alike:
 No man can foretell his Fate.', [['When this quote was said, the messenger was talking to the priest. They were talking about the situation about what was going on with Creon, Haimon, and Antigone. Creon was once happy. He had a wife and children, won many battles, and became king. Then a cruel turn of events happened. He lost sight of what was important and lost it all, just because of a law he had brought up. He may still be king but he doesn’t have what he needs to keep going forward. While I was annotating, I came across this quote, and I said it means that nobody can escape the fate or destiny they are given, even if they are happy or unhappy. The quote is also stating that fate can’t be something interchangeable, it is something you are given and can’t run away from or change.']]), ('There is no happiness where there is no wisdom;
 No wisdom but in submission to the gods.
 Big words are always punished,
 And proud men in old age learn to be wise.', [['This is the main theme of the play.']]), ('I look for comfort; my comfort lies here dead.
 Whatever my hands have touched has come to nothing.
 Fate has brought all my pride to a thought of dust.', [['Creon has now suffered a full peripeteia, which he is acknowledging. He has no more comfort, and everyone around him, “Whatever [his] hands have touched has come to nothing.”']]), ('I have been rash and foolish.
 I have killed my son and my wife.', [['Creon fully accepts responsibility for his actions.']]), ('Kadmeian Semele', [['Semele was a mortal and mother of Dionysos. daughter of Thebes founder, Kadmos.']]), ('Iacchos', [['Dionysos']]), ('And as he died
 He gathered Antigone close in his arms again.
 Choking, his blood bright red on her white cheek.
 And now he lies dead with the dead, and she is his
 At last, his bride in the houses of the dead.', [['Haimon’s suicide reunites him with Antigone in death when he was denied marriage to her in life. This scene has a much more famous successor in the final scene of Shakespeare’s Romeo and Juliet. Both feature an entombed bride (or bride-to-be in Antigone’s case), graveside brawls, and desperate lovers who choose death rather than life without their beloved. The parallel of the tomb and the bridal bed in Antigone’s final speech figures into Paris’s laments over Juliet’s death.']]), ('We saw her lying:
 Haimon lay beside hers,', [['Haimon said he’d take a life upon Antigone’s death. Turns out he was talking about his own. At least the death of his son should really help Creon learn a thing or two about unjust laws and rulings!']]), ('Heavenly Child', [['A child from the heavens that was brought here to bring happiness to life.']])]

name: Show Me How
lyrics:

Show me how you care
Tell me how you were loved before
Show me how you smile
Tell me why your hands are cold
(Show me how)

[Chorus]
I’m turning around
I’m having visions of you
But then I understand
The friend I’m dreaming of is far away
But I’m here... I’m here

[Verse 2]
Show me how you’re proud
Tell me how you reach the moon
My thoughts are away tonight
My heart fell to love again
(Show me how)

annotations:
[('I’m turning around I’m having visions of you
 But then I understand
 The friend I’m dreaming of is far away
 And doesn’t feel my love
 But I do, I do', [['Here she narrates her second thoughts about a former love and recalls memories of old she still cherishes despite her realizations about this love being long gone, hence the “friend” (notable assertion) not feeling her love. A love that, however, she is still able to feel, evoking the idea she still deeply cares for this person']]), ('But then I understand', [['The speaker must continue to remind themself mid-daydream that this relationship is platonic; a painful reality.']]), ('My heart fell to love again', [['There’s a sense that the speaker has involuntarily fallen in love, as it often goes. However, the use of the word “again” suggests that the speaker often uses falling in love as a form of self love. There’s a sense of broke-ness which is reiterated by the speakers fragile voice.']]), ('Show me how you’re proud
 Tell me how you reach the moon', [['She relates to how she still wants to be with her friend for the one that she loves. Although her friend  that she dreams of is far away, she is still invested that person’s casual and love life.']]), ('The friend I’m dreaming of is far away
 But I’m here... I’m here', [['Sometimes we fall in love for someone but they’re just a friend, they don’t see us the same way. It’s like we’re standing in a place fantasizing about someone who’s got they’re mind far far away, they’re distant from our thoughts about them.']]), ('Show me how you care
 Tell me how you were loved before
 Show me how you smile
 Tell me why your hands are cold', [['When you start falling in love with someone all you want is to know more and more about them. She wants him/her to tell more about them, to show her more about who they really are.']])]

lyrics:

name: drive thru poem
lyrics:
I knew I hit rock bottom when the only person who seemed to care was a fastfood worker.
I rolled up to the drive thru at a quarter to midnight and he asked me how I was.
I hadn’t been asked that in what felt like eternity so I answered honestly, I said ‘You know, it’s been a rough night.’
He said ‘Well in that case, you’ve come to the right place.’
And in that moment, as dumb as it sounds, I felt cared about.
Something that I hadn’t felt in forever.
I mean sure, I had been fake cared about.
I’ve had empty ‘How are you’s asked through gritted teeth.
Abandoned “I’m here for you’s placed out of pity.
But if I disappeared of the grit,
an eye wouldn’t bat and a grin wouldn’t fade.
But maybe that fastfood worker would care,
with the fries he’d made.
Maybe he’d wonder why my eyes were so filled with hurt.
Maybe he’d ask me if i wanted a burger with that shake too.
Maybe he’d ask me that, the same way I wished someone would ask me if I wanted a hug with my shitty night in that drive thru.
[instrumental]

name: rosier
lyrics:
[Chorus]
Now there's too many people that I have done wrong
And that I owe my thanks to for sticking along with me
Along for me
(One, two, three, and)

[Verse 1]
Think I'm dreamin'
This isn't real
'Cause you leave in a month
And I'm fiending for something to feel
When you hold me
Know you know me down to my core
This is the calm before the storm
You diverted attention away when I mentioned that someone else gon' need you more

[Chorus]
Now there's too many people that I have done wrong
And that I owe my thanks to for sticking along with me
Along with me
(Oh, oh)
(Who are you?)

[Verse 2]
And I fell apart in that bed
What we built isn't me
Won't put it back together again
He didn't answer me
I can't take back what I said
I just look through those messages
I left on read
Oh, and I took you to rosier
'Cause I thought we could cope
We got out on the ocean
I fell out my boat
And you calmed me back down
And you gave me some hope
And I tossed that away for a seratone

[Chorus]
Now there's too many people that I have done wrong
And that I owe my thanks to for sticking along with me
Along with me
(Oh, oh)

[Bridge]
No commitments
I'm going to hell, you're going to heaven
It doesn't negate our holy connection
And next time I fly too close to the sun
I'm not gonna run, this shit was for fun

[Verse 3]
(Fifty, fifty, fifty)
I left home now I'm fucked up
Realized how much I loved you
Whole god damn life, been a suck-up
Now I'm just tryna get my luck up
All the pain went when you kissed me
We were ten toes up, now I'm six feet down
Moved on, you don't need me now
Now I gotta figure me out
Uh! Brakence
No, I gotta figure me out, oh-ooh, yeah, uh
Bitch, I'm up next
Fuckboy ain't a threat
Put a price on my head
Won't sell my soul for a check
That's on God, that's on sound
You won't ever see me 'round
I'll be cookin' up some shit that'll probably get me out this town

[Outro]
So far, are these visual things the only effect you find?
annotations:
[('Fuckboy ain’t a threat', [['Reference to one of his other songs on the album, fuckboy.']]), ('No, I gotta figure me out, oh-ooh, yeah, uh', [['Figuring yourself out is a key part of growing up and developing yourself as a person. Here we see the artist jump right into this process by reverting to primal yells and squeals, specifically ‘oh-ooh, yeah, uh’. Although the individual sounds can be made by a variety of animals, the sequencing makes it possible that the artist is in fact a Rhesus Macaque monkey. Mainly found on the Asian continent, this type of monkey has a large population due to the large amount of people embracing their true identity. It is uncommon though for Americans, as brakence is, to identify with this foreign monkey. He has however mentioned within his music his desire to get out of his current town. This clue made many of his fans anticipate him to embrace his Rhesus Macaque identity and move to India in the near future.']]), ('I’ll be cookin’ up some shit that’ll probably get me out this town', [['Unhappy with the current circumstances he finds himself embroiled in, a plan is hatched to become a famous chef akin to the now-famous Gordon Ramsey. Earning such a reputation and skills of a professional chef would earn the artist considerable wealth allowing him to afford housing outside of his ‘town’ and therefore he can get out.']]), ('So far, are these visual things the only effect you find?', [['A sample from this video, also used in prozac.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=luYL5GlSO7k&ab_channel=thehomeofthevain']]), ('(Who are you?)', [['Sample of an anonymous girl speaking about her experience with LSD from a 1966 Canadian television documentary entitled “How To Go Out Of Your Mind: The LSD Crisis,” beginning at approximately 0:25 in this YouTube video.

https://youtu.be/wBICQjYjcpM?t=24']]), ('That’s on God, that’s on sound', [['People may say “I swear to God” or even declare a formal oath with a hand placed on a holy book to demonstrate their sincerity in a promise. In this line, brakence is ‘swearing on God’ that he will succeed without selling out. He swears ‘on sound’ itself, revealing to listener how he regards music; as important and honorable as a god.']]), ('And next time I fly too close to the sun', [['Referring to the Greek myth of Icarus. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Icarus']]), ('Oh, and I took you to rosier', [['Possibly referring to Cape Rosier in Brooksville, Maine, a small coastal community.']]), ('I fell out my boat
 And you calmed me back down
 And you gave me some hope
 And I tossed that away for a seratone', [['He tells us that this person whom he is referring to pulled him out of a substandard mindset that he was in. He explained how he felt like he had hope for himself with this person, however, he threw it away for a platform.

Seratone: A type of pre-finished wall or tile.
He took the seratone to build that platform and community.']]), ('And I fell apart in that bed
 What we built isn’t me
 Won’t put it back together again', [['He is addressing the fact that he broke while thinking in his bed about the relationship he had with his ex-partner. He understands that he was not built off of the relationship they had and he understands that it is too late to fix it. He will not try to fix the relationship that he feels he broke. Because he needs to focus on himself in 2020 (a line said in “fuckboy”)']])]

name: Star Shopping
lyrics:
[Verse]
Wait right here
I'll be back in the mornin'
I know that I'm not that important to you
But to me, girl, you're so much more than gorgeous (Yeah)
So much more than perfect (Yeah)
Right now I know that I'm not really worth it
If you give me time, I could work on it
Give me some time while I work on it
Losin' your patience, and, girl, I don't blame you
The Earth's in rotation, you're waitin' for me (Yeah)
Look at my face when I fuck on your waist
'Cause we only have one conversation a week
That's why your friends always hatin' on me
Fuck 'em though, I did this all by myself
Matter fact, I ain't never asked no one for help
And that's why I don't pick up my phone when it rings
None of my exes is over Lil Peep
Nobody flexin' as much as I be
That's why she text me and tell me she love me
She know that someday I'll be over the sea
Makin' my money and smokin' my weed
I think it's funny, she open up to me, get comfortable with me
Once I got it comin', I love her, she love me
I know that I'm nothing like someone her family want me to be
If I find a way, would you walk it with me?
Look at my face while you talkin' to me
'Cause we only have one conversation a week
Can I get one conversation at least?
Shout out to everyone makin' my beats, you helpin' me preach
This music's the only thing keepin' the peace when I'm fallin' to pieces

[Chorus]
Look at the sky tonight, all of the stars have a reason
A reason to shine, a reason like mine and I'm fallin' to pieces
Look at the sky tonight, all of the stars have a reason
annotations:
[('Once I got it comin’, I love her, she love me
 I know that I’m nothing like someone her family want me to be
 If I find a way, would you walk it with me?', [['Living a love story with Emma Harris since fifth grade, Peep did not always match his girlfriend’s family’s expectations. With his social appearance often changing over the years, wearing tattoos and piercings by the end of middle school, Emma’s parents became wary of Peep: he was no longer the boyfriend they wanted for their daughter. The Long Island rapper refers this situation in his song “Keep My Coo,” first released in November 2014.

She said, “Why you got so many tattoos?”
So when your daddy see me out, he know I’m bad news

Besides his outward appearance, Emma’s parents didn’t like Peep’s hobbies either. Gus had indeed started a rap career under the name of TrapGoose after dropping out of high school. He released a first EP but early days were hard: Peep spent several months trying to get his music going on, but it still didn’t make enough money for him to pay his rent.

He ended up flying back to his mother’s house on Long Island. Gus was aware that he might never make a living out of music and noticed that friends of his had also lost hope in his success. As a result, Gus asks his girlfriend through this music if she would be willing to follow him through if he found a way to live off his music and be recognized by Emma’s parents.']]), ('Look at the sky tonight, all of the stars have a reason
 A reason to shine, a reason like mine and I’m fallin’ to pieces
 Look at the sky tonight, all of the stars have a reason', [['Gus talks about meaning about life and everyone’s importance, a meaning which he was also, but that didn’t apply in himself.

Talks about how every star on sky has a reason to be there and shine (their application in Astronomy to be able to make precise locations of the different Celestial Bodies), and how that can be applied on people.

Each person has their reason to be on Earth: to seek their dreams and be happy, shining for themselves.

“All of the stars have a reason” is also a quotation of poem named “Послушайте!” written by Vladimir Mayakovsky.']]), ('Look at my face when I fuck on your waist
 ’Cause we only have one conversation a week', [['Keeping with the heavy theme of unrequited love, Gus illustrates the awkward and antisocial aspects of the relationship. A lack of eye contact could suggest multiple things about what this girl feels about Peep:


Intimidation, the girl feels disheartened by peep’s reckless drug taking and feels dismayed by his appearance and provocative behavior.
Lack of attraction, simply put, the girl has no feelings for Peep anymore, possibly hinting at how the girl is only in the relationship for self-gain, in other words, this girl only uses him to get money and fame. This is something Peep has alluded to in the past.
Unaffiliation, a lack of eye contact could suggest a dearth of knowledge you exist, meaning nothing other than she doesn’t want to notice Peep.
Anti-intimacy, the girl doesn’t like Peep at all, suggesting a conscious decision of making an effort to NOT look at him.']]), ('Shout out to everyone makin’ my beats, you helpin’ me preach', [['While “Star Shopping” was produced by Nashville producer Kryptik, Peep was also frequently working with producers such as mysticphonk, Greaf and NEDARB around this time in his career.']]), ('Losin’ your patience, and, girl, I don’t blame you
 The Earth’s in rotation, you’re waitin’ for me (Yeah)', [['Time on Earth is measured in rotations of the Earth (days and nights) and revolutions of the Earth around the sun (years).

Time is passing with every day and night while Peep’s mystery girl waits on him. With all this time going by, Peep understands that his girl can’t wait much longer.']])]

name: Surf
lyrics:
[Intro]
Yeah, yeah
Hey, hey, hey
Hey, hey, hey
Hey, hey, hey
Hey, hey
Said

[Verse 1]
Where are you goin'? Can I come too?
The whole world is open, a playground for me and you
And we could be fine, shit, who the hell knows?
It's your eyes and your ears and your mouth and your nose
Head and your shoulders, your knees and your toes
I dream of this moment
Will it come true?
The whole world, they know it
They just waitin' for me and you
And she, just like I
Got her head in the clouds
Don't need to be lower
Before it's all over, I promise we'll figure it out
I ain't comin' down
Why would I need to?
So much of this world is above us, baby
They might tell you that I went crazy
I'm just tryna read you
Ooh, ooh, oohh
Ooh-ooh-oohh

[Chorus]
I know we try
And the days, they go by
Until we get old
There's water in the flowers, let's grow
People, they lie
But hey, so do I
Until it gets old
There's water in the flowers, let's grow

[Post-Chorus]
Let it go, let it be
We're all we need today
Let it go, let it be
Mmm, mmm, mmm, mmm

[Verse 2]
Yeah, well
Sometimes I get lonely
Not when I'm alone
But it's more when I'm standin' in crowds
That I'm feelin' the most on my own
And I know that somebody knows me
I know somewhere there's home
I'm startin' to see that all I have to do is get up and go

[Bridge]
Goin', goin', goin' before I'm gone
Gotta get goin', goin', goin' before I'm gone

[Chorus]
Ayy, and I know we try
Days, they go by
Until we get old
There's water in the flowers, let's grow
People, they lie
But hey, so do I
Until it gets old
There's water in the flowers, let's grow

[Instrumental Outro]
annotations:
[('They might tell you that I went crazy
 I’m just tryna read you', [['Very frequently within relationships, friends of the female/male are quick to say that the other person is “crazy” when in realty, the person is simply in love. Being in love will make you appear crazy to others sometimes but if you’ve ever been in love, you know that you are simply trying to make the other person happy.']]), ('It’s your eyes and your ears and your mouth and your nose
 Head and your shoulders, your knees and your toes', [['Same as with the childlike image of a playground in the last couple lines, Mac Miller is referencing the children’s song “Heads, Shoulders, Knees, and Toes”.']]), ('I’m startin’ to see that all I have to do is get up and go', [['Notice the choice in word…“See” …Mac continuously contrast being blind and seeing.  It’s nothing new to rap.  DMX did this in songs like Damien.

Mac is saying all he has to do is get up and go, meaning his life is his choice.  Where he is, is a result of his decisions.  He can get out of his depression, out of his addiction, out of his head, he just has to get up and go.']]), ('The whole world is open, a playground for me and you
 And we could be fine, shit, who the hell knows?', [['Mac is thinking openly about all the possibilities he has with his lover. He even ventures to say that they could end up ok and healthy.']]), ('And she, just like I
 Got her head in the clouds', [['This could be a direct reference to Ariana Grande, seeing as to how this song is more of a reflection on his life thus far and wondering if he can “come too,” as he either relives the moments in his head.']]), ('Where are you goin’? Can I come too?', [['This line is a call back to the outro of the song “Funeral” on Miller’s 2014 mixtape Faces:

“Where are you going?
Can I come? Can I come?”

Like a circle, his lyrics and state of mind go back to where they were before on Faces.

Miller seems to be seeking aid through guidance, as he often talks about being lost and alone. He also speaks a lot about being stuck in his own head on his album Swimming, so he may be trying to find someone to guide him out of his head, and grow together.

PROPOSED SUGGESTION: he says a similar line in ‘Woods’: “and you need to let me know, when you leave and where you go. can I come?” it’s possible this is just a favorite theme of his or these songs could be talking to the same person.']]), ('Until we get old
 There’s water in the flowers, let’s grow
 People, they lie
 But hey, so do I
 Until it gets old
 There’s water in the flowers, let’s grow', [['Water is used symbolically throughout spiritual literature to represent both life and destruction.

On Swimming, Mac uses the motif of drowning in water to represent his perennial struggles with drug addiction and heartbreak, attempting to overcome them by swimming to shore.

Conversely, here on “Surf”, Mac is above the water and thus has a more positive perspective. Now that he is no longer drowning, he views water as a source of life and personal growth.

Mac previously depicts water as a source of growth on “Time”, saying:

Look at me watering seeds, it’s time to grow

While on “Wings”, he rhymes:

Water my seeds ‘til the flowers just grow, yeah
Love so much that my heart get broke']]), ('Sometimes I get lonely
 Not when I’m alone
 But it’s more when I’m standin’ in crowds
 That I’m feelin’ the most on my own', [['Even though Mac is famous, he has constantly reminded us that this has made it hard for him to connect with people. On “Small Worlds”, Mac raps:

You never told me being rich was so lonely
Nobody know me, oh well
Hard to complain from this five star hotel

While he has many fans, many of them don’t know Mac as Malcolm. Many of them only know him through his music which can be an intimate look into Mac’s mind, it can also be one of the only ways he gets to connect with his fans.

As others have annotated on “Small Worlds”, Mac has written about this in the past on Faces‘ “Happy Birthday”:

There’s a birthday party happening upstairs (Where?)
And it’s all for me, who the fuck cares? (Fuck it)
They don’t notice if I never go and show my face (Face)
They just looking for a reason they can celebrate']]), ('And I know that somebody knows me
 I know somewhere there’s home', [['One prefers one’s home to all other places. “Home is where the heart is” reference here which means = Home is where one is most emotionally attached.

Mac is saying that he doesn’t feel understood by anyone that he is around. Mac has faith that someone in the world will though (possible significant other) Where he can finally be at home.']])]

name: Bubble
lyrics:
[Intro]
I'm trapped in a bubble
I'm having trouble
Getting air
It's so unfair
You're over there
'Cause I just wanna hold you tight
And watch the clouds go by

[Chorus]
When I see my friends again, I'll be okay
When we get together next, we'll celebrate
When I see my friends again, I'll be okay
When we get together next, we'll celebrate

[Verse]
How you been?
Staying in, been forever
I'm feeling numb
And all I want, to be together
Getting choked up
Dreamt that we could float up
I got my hopes up
But that was when I woke up

[Bridge]
You know if there was any other way, I'd be over
We could all be laughing at your place
But I'm stuck here at the window while it rains, 'til it's over
Wish that I could make it go away
You know if there was any other way, I'd be over
We could all be laughing at your place
But I'm stuck here at the window while it rains, 'til it's over
Wish that I could make it go away

[Chorus]
When I see my friends again, I'll be okay
When we get together next, we'll celebrate
When I see my friends again, I'll be okay
When we get together next, we'll celebrate
When I see my friends again, I'll be okay
When we get together next, we'll celebrate

[Outro]
I'm trapped in a bubble
I'm having trouble
Getting air
annotations:
[('When I see my friends again, I’ll be okay', [['Rei Brown wrote this song inspired on the quarantine of COVID-19.

The currently going quarantine that started since March of 2020, encouraged the social distancing and self isolation. This of course in the hearts of many brought lonesome times and depression which Rei Brown expresses in his song.



With faded sweet female vocals, careful tip-toe like string plucks and an eventually coming to the chorus where Rei himself joins in the singing in a very magical vibrant start of the chorus.']])]

name: dropout
lyrics:
[Intro]
I can't wait no longer
Would you say something?
I can't wait no longer (brakence)

[Chorus]
D-D-Dropped out, I was seventeen
Wasting all my money, mixing dope and LSD
Man, mama said, "Don't get ahead of me"
But I don't wanna finish college, I got hella dreams
Well, I don't know what's gotten into me
Ever since I stopped pretending, it was history
Dropped out, I was seventeen
Now I've got more freedom than I've ever seen

[Verse 1]
Life don't have directions
And I been tryin' to quarantine
The thought of heaven in the meantime
I've realized I've been there before
All the doors are closed
Wanted so much more
Now it's nice to know
There's no enemy
Or a victory
It's all costumes, funny dances to—
I can do everything

[Chorus]
D-D-Dropped out, I was seventeen
Wasting all my money, mixing dope and LSD
Man, mama said, "Don't get ahead of me"
But I don't wanna finish college, I got hella dreams
Well, I don't know what's gotten into me
Ever since I stopped pretending, it was history
Dropped out, I was seventeen
Now I've got more freedom than I've ever seen
What other effects?

[Verse 2]
I-I-I love my mama
Don't wanna be apart, man
My brothers say just go get an apartment
Flipping the pages to get into the garden
By now the mara taller, treat me like a God, damn
Feelings rolled up and it's 'bout time
Exhale in the ninth cloud, cloud nine
I got money, I'll expand on it
Cancel your plans, authority couldn't handle us

[Bridge]
Okay, this the type shit that make my hands fall asleep
Low blood sugar and some more caffeine
I don't need loving but I want that cheap
So much luck that I've laughed to pieces

[Verse 3]
Looked inside for some consolation
I found a bi-dime in his prime, embraced it, I
Learned it was never complicated
You are who you are, don't keep you waiting
I said you are who you are, don't keep you waiting
(I can't wait no longer)
I said you
(Won't you say something)
I said you are who you are, man
(I can't wait no longer)

[Chorus]
D-D-Dropped out, I was seventeen
Wasting all my money, mixing dope and LSD
Mama said, "Don't get ahead of me"
But I don't wanna finish college, I got hella dreams
I don't know what's gotten into me
Ever since I stopped pretending, it was history
Dropped out, I was seventeen
Now I've got more freedom than I've ever seen
(brakence)

[Outro]
He was only in town for like, a month, and we've been friends for like-
annotations:
[('Feelings rolled up and it’s ’bout time
 Exhale in the ninth cloud, cloud nine', [['brakence talks about purchasing, rolling and smoking a marijana cigarette, known to exacerbate feelings.']]), ('He was only in town for like, a month, and we’ve been friends for like-', [['A short sample of the following YouTube video:
https://youtu.be/mbLqly9zE-E?t=150

The sample ends abruptly but transitions into the next track, “fwb,” continuing it.']]), ('Okay, this the type shit that make my hands fall asleep
 Low blood sugar and some more caffeine
 I don’t need loving but I want that cheap
 So much luck that I’ve laughed to pieces', [['In the bridge, brakence is referencing his usage of narcotics and caffeine to deal with ongoing stress.

This line is also used in his song “prozac.”']]), ('D-D-Dropped out, I was seventeen
 Wasting all my money, mixing dope and LSD
 Man, mama said, “Don’t get ahead of me”
 But I don’t wanna finish college, I got hella dreams
 Well, I don’t know what’s gotten into me
 Ever since I stopped pretending, it was history
 Dropped out, I was seventeen
 Now I’ve got more freedom than I’ve ever seen', [['brakence dropped out of Ohio State University after only 2 weeks, as he decided it was not for him.

Instead, he chose to pursue his career in music, which was met with reluctance from his family. They didn’t want him to make a hasty decision after so little time.

He proved to himself that it was ultimately the best decision and his growing success has further validated that he made the right call.']]), ('It’s all costumes, funny dances to—', [['The full lyric

It’s all costumes, funny dances to play my mind

was used in Well Known by Atlas in Motion which featured brakence and 50Landing. It was released earlier this year.']])]

name: Feeling Whitney
lyrics:
[Intro]
I've been looking for someone...
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh

[Verse 1]
And I've been looking for someone to put up with my bullshit
I can't even leave my bedroom so I keep it pouring
And I ain't seen the light of day since, well, that's not important, it's been long
And I was feeling Whitney, me and my homies sip the Houston
Cars and clothes, thought I was winnin', you knew I was losing
You told me to wake up but my clock always stays on snooze and I'm done

[Chorus]
To each their own and find peace in knowin'
Ain't always broken, but here's to hopin'
Show no emotion, against your coding
Just act as hard as you can
You don't need a friend
Boy, you're the man

[Post-Chorus]
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh

[Verse 2]
And I've been looking for someone that I can buy my drugs from
It seems like every plug ran east to Utah, became Mormons
Drought comes around, feels like I have no one to depend on
Sober, ugh
I had eighty beers on Tuesday night, I had nothing to do then
I put on a little Dwight and sang a happy tune
And lit a cigarette, stepped out the door, had an appearance
Drank more

[Chorus]
To each their own and find peace in knowin'
Ain't always broken, but here's to hopin'
Show no emotion, against your coding
Just act as hard as you can
You don't need a friend
Boy, you're the man

[Post-Chorus]
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh
Ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh, ooh-ooh, ooh
annotations:
[('Drought comes around, feels like I have no one to depend on
 Sober, ugh
 I had eighty beers on Tuesday night, I had nothing to do then', [['A “drought” is a prolonged of a shortage of water or something specified–in this case, alcohols and drugs are symbolic of water. In fact, Post Malone referred to bud light as his “water” in an interview with Hot 97 during which he downing Bud Light cans at 10:00 am.

Some fans have even taken to the internet to discuss his “drinking problem.” To Post, however, it’s a quick cure to his anxiety and stage fright. In an interview with HIGHSNOBIETY, he discusses one of the reasons he drinks:

Definitely alcohol, I love to drink, I love to get funky. That’s where it all comes from. You know, I’m a shy guy, so I’ll drink a bottle of champagne and get in the booth, then see where it goes from there.']]), ('Cars and clothes, thought I was winnin’, you knew I was losing', [["The theme of this line is very similar to that of Post Malone’s recently released tracks “Rich & Sad” and “Better Now” from beerbongs & bentleys, where he explores the fact that his life is still empty despite having money:


I just keep on wishin' that the money made you stay, ayy
You know I would throw it all away

Because no matter how my life has changed
I keep on looking back on better days"]]), ('You told me to wake up but my clock always stays on snooze and I’m done', [['Lean, a popular concoction which includes a prescription-strength cough syrup and typically some kind of soft drink, can cause symptoms of drowsiness when the buzz wears off. Although Post is physically awake after a period of drinking lean, he is emotionally asleep.

Malone also recently tatted the phrase “Always Tired” on his face–the tat may embody the millennial cult of exhaustion. Many fans have taken to the internet to express their reliability to the feeling.']]), ('And I’ve been looking for someone to put up with my bullshit
 I can’t even leave my bedroom so I keep it pouring', [['“Pouring” is likely a reference to the action of mixing lean, concoction which includes a prescription-strength cough syrup and typically some kind of soft drink.

In a live interview with GQ, Post went undercover on Quora responded to the question “What does Post Malone mean when he says he was ‘Feeling Whitney?’”:

This song is about whenever I was a little boy and I had just moved out to L.A. and I was 18 and getting into trouble and everything…So yes, that’s what kind of this song was about; just locking myself in a dark place and doing bad things.

Post expands on the “dark” aspect of his drug abuse in the next line:

And I ain’t seen a light of day since, well, that’s not important']]), ('And I ain’t seen the light of day since, well, that’s not important, it’s been long', [['Johnny Cash used a line similar to this in his song “Folsom Prison Blues”:

And I ain’t seen the sunshine since I don’t know when

Cash has had a major impact on Post Malone’s music, evident by when he said the following:

He’s a great storyteller. I’ve always loved the live San Quentin performance. Just the pure joy that you can see from all the people that were in jail, that Johnny came to rock with them and stuff and show ‘em some love, just, you know, is really inspiring. It’s really super dope, and it shows music that no matter where you are or where you’re at, you know, people can always relate and get excited about something.

Cash’s impact isn’t limited to Post’s music, but also Post himself — Post got a tattoo of the singer’s face on his left arm.']]), ('To each their own and find peace in knowin’
 Ain’t always broken, but here’s to hopin’
 Show no emotion, against your coding
 Just act as hard as you can
 You don’t need a friend
 Boy, you’re the man', [['Austin is commenting on society’s disapproval of a man showing emotions or mental illness, depression, or loneliness. He had to act like everything’s okay, and that he’s not lonely and doesn’t need a friend.

This is also Post trying to convince himself that keeping his personality hidden, acting hard, and secluding himself from friends is the best way to live. Obviously, it’s driving him mad and bringing on depression, as well as alcohol and drug use.']]), ('And I’ve been looking for someone that I can buy my drugs from
 It seems like every plug ran east to Utah, became Mormons', [['A plug is slang for a drug dealer.

Mormons are members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints, a Christian church that practices strict sobriety as part of its teachings. Utah is historically a Mormon state; it was settled in 1847 when Mormon communities fled to escape persecution.

This strict sobriety is called the Word Of Wisdom, and by saying ‘every plug ran east’ he’s saying that the Mormon missionaries converted all the people he used to get drugs from and they moved to Utah.

This line became somewhat ironic in 2018 when Post Malone moved to Utah and bought a house there.']]), ('And I was feeling Whitney, me and my homies sip the Houston', [['This song mainly focuses on Malone’s relationship with drug use. “Feeling Whitney” can refer to the use of certain drugs such as painkillers, similar to how Whitney Houston had self-destructive behavior prior to her premature death. While Malone’s drug use has not resulted in fatal outcomes, this line expresses the fluctuations in moods one experiences when they are constantly using.

“Sipping Houston” is a reference to sipping lean, a drug cocktail that originated from Houston, Texas. Lean was popularised in rap music from Houston, and Houston is Whitney’s last name. In an answer on Quora, Post explained the meaning behind the line:

This is a great question and I don’t feel like I get this question a lot. This song is about whenever I was a little boy and I had just moved out to L.A. and I was 18 and getting into trouble and everything. And you know, Whitney Houston, and Houston is associated with lean. And so I was saying, “My homies sip like Houston,” as in the lean. So yes, that’s what kind of this song was about; just locking myself in a dark place and doing bad things.']]), ('I put on a little Dwight and sang a happy tune', [['Dwight Yoakam is a famous country singer known for his smash hit “Suspicious Minds.”']])]

name: Blade Of Hope
lyrics:
[Verse 1]
Wide eyed when your pill digests
And your eyes outlined like an anime
Oh you got Trident like Poseidon
Oh you got night sky with the cracks in
Social so you could talk for me
Oh you got sidelined by emotion
We can't leave our diplomat behind
You've been holding something back for time
I can't be the only one that knows
I can't make it any less on you

[Chorus 1]
Oh, when the willows
Things we shouldn't know
Oh, when the willows here die I won't tell you
That's all, that's all, that's all

[Verse 2]
Silk wings, I should never call these girls
Everything makes me feel weird
I literally just turned 20
I will get nostalgic now
I will put roots in the world
Whole universe in your palms

[Chorus 2]
Since I made it here
We might as well take this
Since I will know when it's over and this isn't it
That's all, that's all, that's all

annotations:
[('And I just wish I could go outside
 Without this fear of harm', [['Tommy doesn’t fit the body he’s in. He feels the public eyes judging him and weighing him down. The “fear of harm” is the anxiousness and paranoia that is created from his identity in his head fighting with his identity from his appearance.']]), ('They say they saw him with a gun
 They think he’ll stop but they don’t know
 There’s people talking in the dark
 They seem to care
 And I keep falling in and out
 And it leaves me rotten
 But I doubt he’s had enough
 Had enough, had enough', [['Tommy’s likely referring to himself in the third person as he doesn’t feel like he’s in his body']]), ('A pistol and a small town
 We’ve seen it all before', [['something bad is going to happen… murder maybe suicide? it has been done before…']]), ('I wish that I could crawl out
 My skin
 And see the world', [['shrimp wishes he could see the world from an outside perspective to see the world in a different viewpoint from his']]), ('This body means nothing to me
 At all', [['shrimp is saying at this point of his downward spiral he doesn’t care what happens to his body because he has given up']]), ('And why am I always the bad guy
 When I just try to help', [['everyone points fingers at the person who is different then everyone else.']]), ('Feels like i’m standing on the outside
 Looking in
 And I know this body’s not mine', [['i think tommy is saying what he is living in doesn’t seem real.']])]

annotations:
[('We could be', [['This chorus may have been influenced by Lykke Li’s “utopia” since they sound similar. Both artists have worked with Rostam and each is the last song off their respective albums.']]), ('I wouldn’t ask you to take care of me', [['This song could be a different perspective on the single “sis” https://genius.com/Clairo-sis-lyrics which is rumored to be about being taken care of by her significant other.']]), ('Ice cold, baby, I’m ice cold', [['This line shares some similarities to the opening lines of “Pilot Jones” by Frank Ocean:

We once had things in common
Now the only thing we share is the refrigerator Ice cold, baby, I told you, I’m ice cold (Ice cold!)

Clairo has mentioned she is a fan of Frank’s music, previously covering his songs and even catching the train to see his concert only days after getting her wisdom teeth out.

Following the release of “I Wouldn’t Ask You” a fan took to Twitter to ask Clairo about the Frank Ocean link, receiving a like in the process:
https://twitter.com/thegodofspace/status/1159566557560889344?s=21']])]
